info.header: AAL2UN (AAL2 Singnalling at UNI in RNC)
info.csv_title: AAL2UN (AAL2 Singnalling at UNI in RNC)

temp_table.name: AAL2UN
temp_table.ui_name: AAL2 Singnalling at UNI in RNC

kpi_info.title: period_duration (period_duration)
kpi_info.use: Duration of the measurement period in minutes.

kpi_info.title: NET_OUT (M548C1)
kpi_info.use: Network out of order (#38). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 38. It indicates that the network is not functioning correctly, and that the condition is likely to last a relatively long time and attempting the call immediately again is not likely to succeed. UPDATED: All connections of the signalling link are released if the signalling link is dropped to 'unavailable' state. The counter is updated for each released connection.

kpi_info.title: TEMP_FAIL (M548C2)
kpi_info.use: Temporary failure (#41). The number of connections terminated by Cause No. 41. Not in use. UPDATED: Not updated.

kpi_info.title: CONGESTION (M548C3)
kpi_info.use: Switching equipment congestion (#42). The number of connections terminated by Cause No. 42. Not in use. UPDATED:Not updated.

kpi_info.title: REQ_CHAN (M548C4)
kpi_info.use: Requested circuit/channel not available (#44). UPDATED: Updated when response to AAL2 signalling request with error cause no. 44 is received by RNC.

kpi_info.title: RES_UNAVAIL (M548C5)
kpi_info.use: Resource unavailable unspecified (#47). The number of connections terminated by Cause No. 47. UPDATED: Updated when response to AAL2 signalling request with error cause no. 47 is received by RNC.

kpi_info.title: AAL_PARA (M548C6)
kpi_info.use: AAL parameters can not be supported (#93). Not in use. UPDATED: Not updated.

kpi_info.title: INVALID_MSG (M548C7)
kpi_info.use: Invalid message (#95). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 95. This cause is used to report an invalid message event only when no other cause in the invalid message class applies. UPDATED:When an AAL2 message has an invalid or unrecognized parameter.

kpi_info.title: MANDAT_INFO (M548C8)
kpi_info.use: Mandatory information element is missing (#96). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 96. This cause indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message which is missing an information element which must be present in the message before it can be processed. UPDATED:If a mandatory information is missing from an AAL2 message.

kpi_info.title: MSG_NOT_IMPL (M548C9)
kpi_info.use: Message type non-existent or not implemented (#97). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 97. This cause indicates that the equipment sending the cause has received a message with a message type it does not recognize either because the message type is not defined, or is defined but not implemented by the equipment sending this cause. UPDATED:When an AAL2 message is received for an already established connection but the message is not recognized.

kpi_info.title: INFO_NOT_IMPL (M548C10)
kpi_info.use: Information element non-existent or not implemented (#99). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 99. It indicates that the equipment sending this cause has received a message which includes information elements/parameters not recognized because they are not defined, or are defined but not implemented by the equipment sending the cause. This cause indicates that the information elements/parameters were discarded. However, the information element is not required to be present in the message for the equipment sending the cause to process the message. UPDATED:When a message which includes unrecognized or not implemented information elements/parameters is received.

kpi_info.title: INVALID_INFO (M548C11)
kpi_info.use: Invalid information element contents (#100). Not in use. UPDATED: Not updated.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_ERQ (M548C12)
kpi_info.use: Recovery on ERQ timer expiry (#102). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 102 establish request. Establish request Primitive is used by the AAL type 2 served user to initiate the establishment of a new AAL type 2 connection. UPDATED:If the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity does not answer to the ERQ message within the defined timeframe. The time is fixed by the system as 30 seconds.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_REL (M548C13)
kpi_info.use: Recovery on REL_timer expiry (#102). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 102 release request. Release request Primitive is used by the AAL type 2 served user to initiate the clearing of an AAL type 2 connection. UPDATED:If the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity does not answer to the REL message within the defined timeframe. The time is fixed by the system as 60 seconds.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_RES (M548C14)
kpi_info.use: Recovery on RES_timer expiry (#102). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 102 reset request. Reset request is a Primitive to request the AAL type 2 signalling entity to reset a particular channel, all channels on a particular AAL type 2 path, or all channels on all AAL type 2 paths between two nodes to the "Idle" state and to indicate this to the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity. UPDATED:If the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity does not answer to the RES message within the given timeframe. The time is adjustable by the user if the reset request is initiated by MML.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_BLO (M548C15)
kpi_info.use: Recovery on BLO_timer expiry (#102). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 102 block request. The block request is a Primitive to request the AAL type 2 signalling entity to locally block a particular, unblocked AAL type 2 path and to indicate this to the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity. UPDATED:If the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity does not answer to the BLO message within the given timeframe. The time is adjustable by the user if the blocking request is initiated by MML.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_UBL (M548C16)
kpi_info.use: Recovery on UBL_timer expiry (#102). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 102 unblock request. Unblock request is a Primitive to request the AAL type 2 signalling entity to locally unblock a particular, blocked AAL type 2 path and to indicate this to the peer AAL type 2 signalling entity. UPDATED:If the peer entity does not answer to the UBL message within the given timeframe. The time is adjustable by the user if the unblocking request is initiated by MML.

kpi_info.title: MSG_UNRECOG (M548C17)
kpi_info.use: Message with unrecognized parameter, discarded (#110). This counter provides the number of connections terminated by Cause No. 110. This cause indicates that the equipment sending the cause has discarded a received message which contains a parameter that is not recognized. UPDATED:If an AAL2 signalling message is discarded because of an unrecognized parameter.

kpi_info.title: SAI_ALLOC (M548C18)
kpi_info.use: Originating Signalling Association Identifier (OSAI) allocation failure. An internal resource reservation fails for AAL2 connection establishment. Internal (nonprotocol) error. UPDATED:When internal resources for AAL2 signalling processing cannot be reserved.

kpi_info.title: CID_VERIF (M548C19)
kpi_info.use: The CID verification/allocation failure. Not in use. UPDATED: Not updated.

kpi_info.title: AAL2PI_VERIF (M548C20)
kpi_info.use: The AAL type 2 ID verification/allocation failure. Not in use. UPDATED: Not updated.

kpi_info.title: BINDING_ID_VERIF (M548C21)
kpi_info.use: Binding ID verification failure. Not in use. UPDATED:Not updated.

kpi_info.title: LINK_CHAR_VERIF (M548C22)
kpi_info.use: Required traffic characterization unavailable. Not in use. UPDATED: Not updated.

kpi_info.title: ADJ_NODE_NOT_AVAIL (M548C23)
kpi_info.use: Adjacent node not available. The connection establishment is rejected because the signalling relation to the adjacent AAL type 2 node was not available. Internal (non-protocol) error. UPDATED:When sending the ERQ message does not succeed because the signalling link is unavailable, for example, because of the wrong state of the link.

kpi_info.title: COMMON (M548C24)
kpi_info.use: The number of connection events started in the AAL2 signalling. UPDATED: When ERQ message sending request is received.

kpi_info.title: OUT_ERQ_ATTEMPT (M548C25)
kpi_info.use: The number of outgoing AAL2 connection establishment requests. UPDATED: When AAL2 Establishment Request (ERQ) message is sent.

kpi_info.title: OUT_ERQ_SUCCESS (M548C26)
kpi_info.use: The number of successful outgoing AAL2 connection establishment. UPDATED: When AAL2 Establishment Confirm (ECF) message is received.

kpi_info.title: IN_ERQ_ATTEMPT (M548C27)
kpi_info.use: The number of incoming AAL2 connection establishment requests. UPDATED: When AAL2 Establishment Request (ERQ) message is received.

kpi_info.title: IN_ERQ_SUCCESS (M548C28)
kpi_info.use: The number of successful incoming AAL2 connection establishment. UPDATED: When AAL2 Establishment Confirm (ECF) message is sent.

kpi_info.title: OUT_MOD_ATTEMPT (M548C29)
kpi_info.use: The number of outgoing AAL2 connection modification requests. UPDATED: When AAL2 Modification Request (MOD) message is sent.

kpi_info.title: OUT_MOD_SUCCESS (M548C30)
kpi_info.use: The number of successful outgoing AAL2 connection modifications. UPDATED: When AAL2 Modification Acknowledge (MOA) message is received.

kpi_info.title: IN_MOD_ATTEMPT (M548C31)
kpi_info.use: The number of incoming AAL2 connection modification requests. UPDATED: When AAL2 Modification Request (MOD) message is received.

kpi_info.title: IN_MOD_SUCCESS (M548C32)
kpi_info.use: The number of successful incoming AAL2 connection modifications. UPDATED: When AAL2 Modification Acknowledge (MOA) message is sent.

kpi_info.title: MOD_FAIL_RES (M548C33)
kpi_info.use: The number of failed AAL2 connection modifications because of resource unavailable. UPDATED: When AAL2 modification fails due to unavailable internal ATM resource.

kpi_info.title: MOD_FAIL_INT (M548C34)
kpi_info.use: The number of failed AAL2 connection modifications because of internal error. UPDATED: When AAL2 modification fails due to internal error.

kpi_info.title: MOD_FAIL_COLL (M548C35)
kpi_info.use: The number of failed AAL2 connection modifications because of collision. UPDATED: When AAL2 modification fails due to collision.

kpi_info.title: MOD_FAIL_REM (M548C36)
kpi_info.use: The number of failed AAL2 connection modifications because of failed remote. UPDATED: When AAL2 modification fails due to remote failed.

kpi_info.title: TIMER_EXP_MOD (M548C37)
kpi_info.use: The number of failed AAL2 connection modifications because timer waiting for Modify Acknowledge message expires. UPDATED: When AAL2 modification fails because timer waiting for Modify Acknowledge message expires
